articles.author: Michael Derby
articles.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said Wednesday that market borrowing costs would need to be sustainably higher for that to bear on future central bank monetary policy choices.
articles.title: Fed's Powell says higher rates need to persist to affect Fed policy choices

articles.author: Amruta Khandekar, Shashwat Chauhan
articles.description: Wall Street climbed on Wednesday with investors optimistic about the Federal Reserve keeping interest rates unchanged later in the day, while a pullback in bond yields after the U.S. Treasury Department's refunding plans boosted megacap stocks.
articles.title: Wall St gains as yields slip in run-up to Fed decision

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Toyota Motor (7203.T) said on Wednesday it is raising the wages of nonunion U.S. factory workers just days after the United Auto Workers union won major pay and benefit hikes from the Detroit Three automakers.
articles.title: Toyota hikes wage of US factory workers after UAW labor deals

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vogue magazine owner Conde Nast will trim about 5% of its staff, CEO Roger Lynch said on Wednesday, as the publisher looks to cut costs and grow in a highly competitive digital media landscape.
articles.title: Vogue magazine owner Conde Nast to trim about 5% of staff

articles.author: Arsheeya Bajwa, Akash Sriram
articles.description: The earnings of Intel (INTC.O) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD.O) have offered more evidence a recovery is gathering pace in the personal computer market, boding well for an industry that had been grappling with a supply glut after the pandemic.
articles.title: PC market recovery gathers pace as Intel, AMD tout potential of 'AI PC'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WeWork shares (WE.N) tanked over 35% in premarket trading on Wednesday after media reports that the flexible workspace provider was planning to file for bankruptcy as early as next week.
articles.title: WeWork shares sink on reports of imminent plans for bankruptcy filing

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes hit a densely populated refugee camp in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 50 Palestinians and a Hamas commander, and medics struggled to treat the casualties, even setting up operating rooms in hospital corridors.
articles.title: Israeli military jets strike Gaza camp, says Hamas commander killed

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa, Abdelaziz Boumzar
articles.description: At Lebanon's border with Israel, residents of a Christian village are hoping war can be avoided even as they prepare for the possibility of worsening hostilities between the Lebanese Shi'ite group Hezbollah and Israel.
articles.title: In Lebanon, a Christian village hopes for the best and plans for the worst

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 40 people were killed in Nigeria's Yobe state between Monday and Tuesday after suspected Boko Haram militants shot at villagers and set off a land mine, in the first major attack on the northern eastern state in 18 months, the police said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Suspected Boko Haram kills at least 40 in Nigeria's Yobe state, police say
